titles.secondary: An uplifting mix of music and chat featuring Mac DeMarco

synopses.short: Singer-songwriter Mac DeMarco chats to Craig about his upcoming album ‘Guitar’.
synopses.medium: Singer-songwriter Mac DeMarco chats to Craig about the process of writing, recording and producing his new record ‘Guitar’.
synopses.long:
Singer-songwriter Mac DeMarco chats to Craig about the process of writing, recording and producing his new record ‘Guitar’.

Plus more Original Pirated Material, we step into the Shoes of Blues, and YOU get to choose the final song of the show… but it’s got to be a banger!

Want to get involved? Email craig@bbc.co.uk.

titles.tertiary: Playlist #1: from Alice Coltrane to Miłosz Pękala...

synopses.short: British producer and composer Sam Shepherd, aka Floating Points, takes over the residency.
synopses.medium: British producer and composer Sam Shepherd, aka Floating Points, curates a playlist featuring the tracks which inspired and shaped his forthcoming project ‘Cascade’.
synopses.long: British producer and composer Sam Shepherd, aka Floating Points, curates a playlist full of the tracks that inspired and shaped his forthcoming project ‘Cascade’ which lands in Autumn via Ninja Tune. In the first episode of the series, he has chosen music by the likes of Michael Gregory Jackson, Miłosz Pękala, Alice Coltrane and more!

synopses.short: 6 Music's Artist In Residence is a journey into the musical soul of an artist.
synopses.medium: 6 Music's Artist In Residence is a journey into the musical soul of an artist, based around a theme or mood.
synopses.long: 6 Music's Artist In Residence will be a journey into the musical soul of an artist, based around a theme or mood. Each episode finds the host playing records that have informed specific periods of their life.

synopses.short: Dive into Orbital at the BBC over the last 30 years.
synopses.medium: Dive into Orbital at the BBC over the last 30 years with a selection of their best sessions, mixes and interviews.
synopses.long: Dive into Orbital at the BBC over the last 30 years with a selection of their best sessions, mixes and interviews. Paul and Phil Hartnoll chat through their career with Chris Hawkins, Radcliffe & Maconie and Steve Lamacq. There’s a brilliant half hour mix recorded for Mary Anne-Hobbs in 2022 as well as selected tracks from exclusive sessions in 1993, 1994 and for Lauren Laverne in 2018.
